title: Developer's Guide
text: use Slick, MSE results must compiled Slick class object. Slick object contains information shown plots tables, well metadata information title, introduction, author details. Help documentation Slick class object can found . create Slick object, simply use Slick() function: slick now empty Slick class object:
code: slick <- Slick() slick #>  #> ── An empty object of class `Slick` ──────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── `Title` ── #>  #> ── `Subtitle` ── #>  #> ── `Date` ── #>  #> 2024-07-01 #>  #>  #> ── `Author` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Email` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Institution` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Introduction` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ── `MPs` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #>  #>  #> ── `OMs` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Boxplot` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Quilt` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Kobe` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Spider` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Timeseries` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ℹ Object is empty #>  #>  #>  #> ── `Tradeoff` ── #>  #>  #>  #> ℹ Object is empty

title: Developer's Guide
text: Title, Subtitle, Author, Email, Institution components Slick object populated corresponding functions. optional, useful presenting Slick results App: functions used return information stored component: exception Date, Markdown can used include links, text styling, etc. example, Markdown automatically converted HTML App: example Slick object. created purposes demonstrating key features Slick. introduction can include paragraphs well Markdown italics bold text Links.
code: Title(slick) <- 'An Example Slick Object' Subtitle(slick) <- "This is the subtitle" Author(slick) <- 'Adrian Hordyk' Email(slick) <-  "[adrian@bluematterscience.com](mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com)" Institution(slick) <- "[Blue Matter Science](bluematterscience.com)" Title(slick) #> [1] "An Example Slick Object" Subtitle(slick)  #> [1] "This is the subtitle" Author(slick)  #> [1] "Adrian Hordyk" Email(slick) #> [1] "[adrian@bluematterscience.com](mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com)" Institution(slick) #> [1] "[Blue Matter Science](bluematterscience.com)" Introduction(slick) <- " This is an example Slick object. It has been created for the purposes of demonstrating the key features of Slick.  The introduction can include paragraphs as well as Markdown such as *italics* and **bold** text and [Links](https://slick.bluematterscience.com).   " Introduction(slick, markdown = TRUE)

title: Developer's Guide
text: Title, Subtitle, Introduction support multiple languages. Currently three languages supported: en: English es: Spanish fr: French Multiple languages can included providing named list:
code: Title(slick) <- list(en='This is the English Title',                      es='This is the Spanish Title',                      fr='This is the French Title') Title(slick) #> [1] "This is the English Title" Title(slick, 'es') #> [1] "This is the Spanish Title" Title(slick, 'fr') #> [1] "This is the French Title"

title: Developer's Guide
text: MPs object contains codes, labels, descriptions management procedures (MPs) included Slick object. Code, Label required. example, four MPs: also done : Color used set colors MPs shown plots. specified, default colors used: Preset optional named list, numeric values indicating MPs selected Preset buttons: Add mp slick object
code: mps <- MPs() Code(mps) <- c('MP1', 'MP2', 'MP3', 'MP4') Label(mps) <- c('MP 1', 'MP 2', 'MP 3', 'MP 4') Description(mps) <- c('MP 1 is an example',                   'MP 2 is another example',                  'Another example',                  'The final example') mps <- MPs(Code=c('MP1',                    'MP2',                    'MP3',                    'MP4'),            Label=c('MP 1',                    'MP 2',                     'MP 3',                     'MP 4'),            Description = c('MP 1 is an example',                             'MP 2 is another example',                            'Another example',                            'The final example')) Color(mps) #> [1] "#C87A8A" "#909646" "#00A396" "#9189C7" Preset(mps) <- list('All'=1:4,                     'Last 2'=3:4) MPs(slick) <- mps

title: Developer's Guide
text: OMs object describes structure operating models contained Slick object. Slick objects must completed OMs object. easiest way build Slick object create populate sub-components add Slick object. Create OMs object: OMs object contains two mandatory slots (Factors Design) one optional slot (Preset).
code: oms <- OMs()

title: Developer's Guide
text: Factors data.frame column headings Factor, Level, Description. used describe various factors, levels within factor, operating models included Slick object. simple example Slick object includes results 6 OMs, spanning three levels uncertainty natural mortality (M) two levels steepness (h):
code: Factors(oms) <- data.frame(Factor=c(rep('M',3), rep('h',2)),                            Level=c(0.1,0.2,0.3,0.7,0.9),                            Description=c('Natural Mortality = 0.1',                                          'Natural Mortality = 0.2',                                          'Natural Mortality = 0.3',                                          'Steepness = 0.7',                                          'Steepness = 0.9')                            )  Factors(oms) #>   Factor Level             Description #> 1      M   0.1 Natural Mortality = 0.1 #> 2      M   0.2 Natural Mortality = 0.2 #> 3      M   0.3 Natural Mortality = 0.3 #> 4      h   0.7         Steepness = 0.7 #> 5      h   0.9         Steepness = 0.9

title: Developer's Guide
text: Design matrix nOM rows nFactor columns. values column either numeric values indicating levels corresponding factor, actual level values (.e., Factors$Level) correspond OM. column names Design must match names factors (.e, Factors$Level). Design matrix corresponding Factors :

title: Developer's Guide
text: Preset optional. used add buttons Slick App users can rapidly select different sets OMs. OMs objects, Preset multi-level list. element first level lists must named. names used display ‘Preset’ button App. second level named list element must list length nFactors, element containing numeric values representing levels within factor included preset. example: OMs object now complete. Check function can used make sure errors: OMs object complete, can added Slick object:
code: Preset(oms) <- list('Low h'=list(1:3, 1),                     'High h'=list(1:3, 2)) Check(oms) #>  #> ── Checking: "OMs" ── #>  #> ✔ Complete OMs(slick) <- oms

Ind. 3'),                    Description=c('This is the description of PI 1',                                  'This is the description of PI 2',                                  'This is the description of PI 3')) Value(boxplot) <- array(runif(1E4), dim=c(50, 6, 4, 3)) Boxplot(slick) <- boxplot

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: Slick R package designed visualizing exploring results Management Strategy Evaluation (MSE). MSE involves using closed-loop simulation testing evaluate compare expected performance alternative management methods, often call Management Procedures (MPs), across different hypotheses historical future fishery dynamics, referred Operating Models (OMs). results MSE reported set Performance Indicators (PIs), quantitative measures management objectives fishery stakeholders, managers, decision-makers. Slick allows MSE developers analysts prepare MSE results standardized data structure, easily generate publication quality figures tables, present explore MSE results interactive application.

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: Slick released Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN) future. meantime, Slick can installed Github:
code: # install.packages('pak') pak::pkg_install('blue-matter/Slick') library(Slick)

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: use Slick, results MSE must available Slick data object. Slick App includes several example data objects. See Developer’s Guide documentation creating Slick Data object MSE results.

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: Slick App designed interactively examining MSE results contained within Slick data object. App allows simultaneous presentation various performance metrics can account uncertainty states nature. Slick interactive allows users filter results live order explore robustness performance. Slick can applied decision analysis context specifically designed investigate performance fisheries management procedures tested management strategy evaluation (MSE). Importantly App platform agnostic: results arising MSE framework formatted compatible Slick object can loaded visualized App.

title: Interactive Visualization of MSE Results
text: Slick App can run locally accessed online. run App locally, simply run App(). example data objects can loaded within App, Slick data object can uploaded. Slick data object, object can loaded directly : mySlick completed Slick data object.
code: App(slick=mySlick)

title: Boxplot S4 Object Class — Boxplot-class
code: boxplot <- Boxplot(Code=c('PI1', 'PI2', 'PI3'),                    Label=c('Performance Indicator 1',                          'Performance Indicator 2',                          'Performance Indicator 3'),                    Description = c('This is the description for PI 1',                                    'This is the description for PI 2',                                    'This is the description for PI 3'),                    Value=array(runif(3000), dim=c(10, 10, 10,3)),                    Preset=list('PI and P2'=1:2)  )  boxplot #>  #> ── An object of class `Boxplot` ──────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── `Code` ── #>  #> 1 PI1 #> 2 PI2 #> 3 PI3 #>  #> ── `Label` ── #>  #> 1 Performance Indicator 1 #> 2 Performance Indicator 2 #> 3 Performance Indicator 3 #>  #> ── `Description` ── #>  #> 1 This is the description for PI 1 #> 2 This is the description for PI 2 #> 3 This is the description for PI 3 #>  #> ── `Value` ── #>  #>   Dimension Length #> 1      nsim     10 #> 2       nOM     10 #> 3       nMP     10 #> 4       nPI      3 #>  #> ℹ Mean across MPs and PIs #>        PI1  PI2  PI3 #> MP 1  0.47 0.53 0.46 #> MP 2  0.56 0.50 0.49 #> MP 3  0.52 0.47 0.45 #> MP 4  0.53 0.45 0.47 #> MP 5  0.48 0.49 0.52 #> MP 6  0.49 0.55 0.44 #> MP 7  0.54 0.49 0.49 #> MP 8  0.49 0.46 0.51 #> MP 9  0.47 0.55 0.57 #> MP 10 0.48 0.52 0.49 #>  #> ── `Preset` ── #>  #> ── PI and P2  #> 1 #> 2  Code(boxplot) #> [1] "PI1" "PI2" "PI3" Metadata(boxplot) #>   Code                   Label                      Description #> 1  PI1 Performance Indicator 1 This is the description for PI 1 #> 2  PI2 Performance Indicator 2 This is the description for PI 2 #> 3  PI3 Performance Indicator 3 This is the description for PI 3  # Value(boxplot) Value(boxplot) <- array()  Preset(boxplot) #> $`PI and P2` #> [1] 1 2 #>  Preset(boxplot) <- list()  boxplot #>  #> ── An object of class `Boxplot` ──────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── `Code` ── #>  #> 1 PI1 #> 2 PI2 #> 3 PI3 #>  #> ── `Label` ── #>  #> 1 Performance Indicator 1 #> 2 Performance Indicator 2 #> 3 Performance Indicator 3 #>  #> ── `Description` ── #>  #> 1 This is the description for PI 1 #> 2 This is the description for PI 2 #> 3 This is the description for PI 3 #>  #> ── `Value` ── #>  #> ── `Preset` ── #>

code: boxplot <- Boxplot()  Code(boxplot) <- c('PI1', 'PI2', 'PI3') Label(boxplot) <- c('Performance Indicator 1',                     'Performance Indicator 2',                     'Performance Indicator 3') Description(boxplot) <- c('This is the description for PI 1',                           'This is the description for PI 2',                           'This is the description for PI 3')   Code(boxplot) #> [1] "PI1" "PI2" "PI3" Label(boxplot) #> [1] "Performance Indicator 1" "Performance Indicator 2" #> [3] "Performance Indicator 3" Description(boxplot) #> [1] "This is the description for PI 1" "This is the description for PI 2" #> [3] "This is the description for PI 3"  # Slick Object mySlick <- Slick() Code(mySlick, 'Boxplot') <- Code(boxplot) #> Error in `Code<-`(`*tmp*`, "Boxplot", value = c("PI1", "PI2", "PI3")): unused argument ("Boxplot") Label(mySlick, 'Boxplot') <- Label(boxplot) #> Error in `Label<-`(`*tmp*`, "Boxplot", value = c("Performance Indicator 1", "Performance Indicator 2", "Performance Indicator 3")): unused argument ("Boxplot") Description(mySlick, 'Boxplot') <- Description(boxplot) #> Error in `Description<-`(`*tmp*`, "Boxplot", value = c("This is the description for PI 1", "This is the description for PI 2", "This is the description for PI 3")): unused argument ("Boxplot")  Code(mySlick, type='Boxplot') #> Error in Code(mySlick, type = "Boxplot"): unused argument (type = "Boxplot") Label(mySlick, type='Boxplot') #> Error in Label(mySlick, type = "Boxplot"): unused argument (type = "Boxplot") Description(mySlick, type='Boxplot') #> Error in Description(mySlick, type = "Boxplot"): unused argument (type = "Boxplot")  # Multi-Language Description(boxplot) <- list(en=c('This is the English description for PI 1',                                   'This is the English description for PI 2',                                   'This is the English description for PI 3'),                              es=c('This is the Spanish description for PI 1',                                   'This is the Spanish description for PI 2',                                   'This is the Spanish description for PI 3'),                              fr=c('This is the French description for PI 1',                                   'This is the French description for PI 2',                                   'This is the French description for PI 3') )  Description(boxplot) #> [1] "This is the English description for PI 1" #> [2] "This is the English description for PI 2" #> [3] "This is the English description for PI 3" Description(boxplot, 'es') #> [1] "This is the Spanish description for PI 1" #> [2] "This is the Spanish description for PI 2" #> [3] "This is the Spanish description for PI 3" Description(boxplot, 'fr') #> [1] "This is the French description for PI 1" #> [2] "This is the French description for PI 2" #> [3] "This is the French description for PI 3"

title: Make an example Slick object — Make_Slick
code: Make_Slick(   name = "Unnamed Slick object",   OM = testOM,   MPs = c("DCAC", "AvC", "Fratio", "FMSYref", "FMSYref50", "matlenlim"),   MP_Desc = NULL,   PMs = c("AAVE", "AAVY", "LTY", "P10", "P50", "P100", "PNOF", "STY", "Yield"),   Design = as.data.frame(cbind(rbind(as.matrix(expand.grid(1:2, 1:3, 1:2)), matrix(1,     nrow = 5, ncol = 3)), c(rep(1, 12), 2:6))),   SN = list(Factor_Labels = c("Natural Mortality", "Resilience", "Stock Depletion",     "Robustness"), Labels = list(c("M=0.2", "M=0.3"), c("h=0.5", "h=0.7", "h=0.9"),     c("Dep=0.1", "Dep=0.3"), c("Ref_Case", "L50=0.5", "Vmaxlen=0.1", "Cobs=0.5",     "Perr=0.5", "AC=0.95")), Codes = list(c("M2", "M3"), c("h5", "h7", "h9"), c("D1",     "D3"), c("Ref_case", "mat_low", "dome", "h_Cerr", "h_Perr", "h_AC")), Description =     list(c("M=0.2", "M=0.3"), c("h=0.5", "h=0.7", "h=0.9"), c("Dep=0.1", "Dep=0.3"),     c("Reference Case",       "L50=0.5", "Vmaxlen=0.1", "Cobs=0.5", "Perr=0.5",     "AC=0.95"))),   mods = list(function(OM, lev) {      if (lev == 1) OM@M <- c(0.2, 0.2)      if (lev ==     2) OM@M <- c(0.3, 0.3)      OM  }, function(OM, lev) {      if (lev == 1) OM@h <-     c(0.5, 0.5)      if (lev == 2) OM@h = c(0.7, 0.7)      if (lev == 3) OM@h = c(0.9,     0.9)      OM  }, function(OM, lev) {      if (lev == 1) OM@D <- c(0.1, 0.1)      if     (lev == 2) OM@D <- c(0.3, 0.3)      OM  }, function(OM, lev) {      if (lev == 2)     OM@L50 <- c(0.5, 0.5)      if (lev == 3) OM@Vmaxlen = c(0.1, 0.1)      if (lev == 4)     OM@Cobs = c(0.5, 0.5)      if (lev == 5) OM@Perr = c(0.5, 0.5)      if (lev == 6)     OM@AC = c(0.9, 0.9)      OM  }),   nsim = 48,   MSElist = NULL,   fstYr = NULL,   returnMSEs = F )

title: Create a Slick class object — Slick-class
code:
library(Slick) # Assign values to a new `Slick` object slick <- Slick()  Title(slick) <- 'An Example Slick Object' Subtitle(slick) <- "[Created for the Developer's Guide](https://slick.bluematterscience.com/articles/DevelopersGuide.html)" Date(slick) <- Sys.Date() Author(slick) <- 'Adrian Hordyk' Email(slick) <-  "[mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com](mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com)" Institution(slick) <- "[Blue Matter Science](bluematterscience.com)"  Introduction(slick) <- " This is an example Slick object. It has been created for the purposes of demonstrating the key features of Slick.  The introduction can include paragraphs as well as Markdown such as *italics* and **bold** text and [Links](https://slick.bluematterscience.com). "  # Access values from `Slick` object Title(slick) #> [1] "An Example Slick Object" Subtitle(slick) #> [1] "[Created for the Developer's Guide](https://slick.bluematterscience.com/articles/DevelopersGuide.html)" Date(slick) #> [1] "2024-07-01" Author(slick) #> [1] "Adrian Hordyk" Email(slick) #> [1] "[mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com](mailto:adrian@bluematterscience.com)" Institution(slick) #> [1] "[Blue Matter Science](bluematterscience.com)" Introduction(slick) #> [1] "
This is an example Slick object. It has been created for the purposes of demonstrating the key features of Slick.

The introduction can include paragraphs as well as Markdown such as *italics* and **bold** text and [Links](https://slick.bluematterscience.com).
"  # See ?MPs, ?OMs, ?Boxplot, ?Quilt, etc for examples on populating other # objects

title: Plot Timeseries — plotTimeseries
text: slick Slick-class() object PM_ind numeric value specifying performance indicator plot MP_ind numeric value specifying MP plot. Defaults NULL shows MPs OM_ind numeric value specifying OM plot. Defaults NULL values calculated median across OMs. includeHist Logical. Include historical period projections? col_line Color median line (historical) fill_ribbon1 Fill color inner ribbon col_ribbon1 Color line inner ribbon quants1 Quantiles inner ribbon. Numeric length 2 fill_ribbon2 Fill color outer ribbon col_ribbon2 Color line outer ribbon linetype_ribbon2 Line type outer ribbon quants2 Quantiles outer ribbon. Numeric length 2. MP_label Label use MPs. Either Code Label. Description works well, probably want . size.title Numeric length 1. Size plot title size.axis.title Numeric length 1. Size axis title size.axis.text Numeric length 1. Size axis text size.mp.label Numeric length 1. Size MP labels. Set NULL MP labels targ_color Color target line (exists Target(Timeseries(slick))) targ_name Label target line lim_color Color limit line (exists Limit(Timeseries(slick))) lim_name Label limit line inc_y_label Include label y-axis?

text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot Timeseries — plotTimeseries
text: default Time Series chart plots median, 25th 75th quantiles shaded ribbon, 10th 90th quantiles dashed lines. plot management procedure (MP), quantiles included projections. multiple MPs plotted together, median across simulations shown projections. OM_ind specified, results shown median across operating models.
